decision.option_label: Implement strict sanitization (mask ALL sensitive fields)
Implement strict sanitization (mask ALL sensitive fields)

messages.text: ðŸ“– 3rd grade explanation: When an agent starts looking at what the visitor sees on their screen, there's a moment where nothing shows up yet - like waiting for a TV to turn on. Right now the agent just sees a blank space and doesn't know if it's working or broken. The fix: Show a 'Loading...' spinner so they know it's coming. **Decision?** (1) Add the loading spinner, (2) Skip - agents can figure it out.

ðŸ“– **Your call:** This is about showing a spinner when co-browse starts loading. Without it, agents stare at a blank screen for 1-2 seconds. **Options:** (1) Add loading spinner = better UX, ~2 hours work. (2) Skip = works fine, just no visual feedback. Low priority either way.

ðŸ“– Simple explanation: Blind users use special software that reads the screen out loud. Our co-browse viewer (where agents see the visitor's screen) doesn't have labels for this software to read. So blind agents can't use it. The fix: Add invisible labels that the reading software can find. **Decision?** (1) Add the labels for blind users, (2) Skip - we don't need to support blind agents.

ðŸ“– **Your call:** This is about making co-browse usable for blind agents. Very few users would benefit. **My take:** Skip unless you have blind users or legal requirements (ADA compliance for government clients). Most startups skip this early on.

decision.option_label: Combined ticket: Stripe Cancellation Not Implemented
Combined ticket: Stripe Cancellation Not Implemented
Implement strict sanitization (mask ALL sensitive fields)

messages.text: âœ… Got it! Adding to existing ticket: When invoice fails, show a BLOCKING modal that cannot be dismissed until payment method is fixed. This prevents adding seats or taking any action while payment is broken. I'll add this requirement to TKT-005 (Payment Failure Blocking + Retry UI).
âœ… Linked to payment blocking modal ticket. Marking resolved.

âœ… Confirmed! You want to honor the grace period. I'll mark this as resolved and create a ticket. The fix: Track subscription_ends_at date, schedule the actual plan downgrade for that date, and let users keep access until their paid period ends. Refreshing the dashboard should show a Confirm button now.
âœ… Done! Creating TKT-018: Honor grace period on plan changes. Users keep access until their paid period ends.
âœ… TKT-030 created for grace period. Marking resolved.
âœ… Marked as SKIP - keyboard navigation for cancellations dashboard is not needed.
âœ… Skipping - keyboard navigation for cancellations dashboard not needed.
âœ… Skipped - keyboard nav not needed.
âœ… Marked as SKIP - screen reader accessibility is not a priority for this feature.
âœ… Skipping - screen reader accessibility not prioritized for this feature.
âœ… Skipped - screen reader not prioritized.

âœ… Confirmed as CRITICAL. With orgs having 10s of thousands of call logs, we'll implement: (1) Server-side pagination with limit/offset, (2) Infinite scroll or Load More button, (3) React-virtual for client-side list virtualization. Creating a high-priority ticket.
âœ… Creating TKT-019: Call Logs Pagination (CRITICAL). Implementing server-side pagination + infinite scroll for orgs with 10k+ logs.
âœ… TKT-034 created for pagination. Marking resolved.

ðŸ“– Simple explanation: The Funnel Analytics page shows how many visitors sign up, how many pay, etc. Right now the docs say 'only platform admins can see this' but nobody actually CHECKED if the protection works. Someone could potentially guess the URL and see your conversion data. The fix: Actually verify the security code exists and works. **Decision?** (1) Fix it - verify the protection, (2) Skip - accept the risk.
âœ… Got it! Option 1 selected - we'll verify the Funnel Analytics page has proper admin-only protection. Creating ticket to audit and fix the authorization check.

ðŸ“– Simple explanation: When an admin changes pool settings (like adding/removing agents), sometimes the save doesn't work - but there's no error message. The admin thinks it saved, but it didn't. They walk away, and the change is lost. The fix: Show a little popup saying 'Saved!' or 'Error - try again' so you always know if it worked. **Decision?** (1) Add save/error notifications, (2) Skip - admins can check manually.

ðŸ“– **What happens now if you change nothing:** When voting fails or items fail to load, users see an empty list or nothing happens when they click vote. No error message. They might think the app is broken or keep clicking. **Fix = show toast errors (~1 hour). Skip = users figure it out eventually.**
âœ… You already have this! **TKT-014: Recording Consent Indicator for Visitors**. Marking as resolved and linking.

ðŸ“– **Real-world example:** User signs up with Google â†’ Supabase creates auth.users row â†’ Your trigger to create profile row FAILS (DB timeout, bug, etc) â†’ User is "logged in" but has no profile â†’ They hit /dashboard â†’ Query for profile returns null â†’ Redirect logic breaks â†’ User stuck on blank page or infinite redirect loop. **Fix:** Add fallback to create profile on-demand if missing. ~30 min fix.

**Let me clarify:** This is about Better Uptime monitoring config. The docs say free tier = 3-min checks, but monitors are set to 1-min. Either monitors fail to create OR you get charged $20/mo unexpectedly. **Options:** (1) Change to 3-min = stay free, (2) Keep 1-min = pay $20/mo, (3) Skip = this is just a docs issue, not code. What would you like to do?
âœ… Decision confirmed: Update monitors to 3-minute check frequency to stay on free tier. Ticket TKT-008 created.
âœ… Decision to use 3-min checks confirmed. Marking resolved.

ðŸ“– **Solo dev perspective:** An incident runbook matters LESS when you are the only one who knows the system. But it matters MORE if: (1) You are asleep when alerts fire, (2) You forget how to fix things under pressure, (3) You ever want to hire or take vacation. **My take:** Create a simple 1-pager with common issues + fixes. Takes 30 min, saves hours later. Or skip - you know your system.
âœ… Yep! You have **TKT-014: Recording Consent Indicator for Visitors**. Already covered. Marking as resolved.

ðŸ“– **Simple version:** Your code has a list of account states: active, cancelled, past_due, AND paused. But the diagram showing how accounts move between states forgot to include "paused". So if someone asks "what happens when an account is paused?" the diagram has no answer. **Fix:** Add paused to the diagram. **Skip:** It's just docs, code works fine.

âœ… Yes, code works fine for paused users! The issue is just that the STATE DIAGRAM (a picture in the docs) forgot to show the "paused" box. The actual code handles paused correctly. **This is a docs-only issue.** Skip it unless you want perfect documentation.

ðŸ“– **When this happens:** Stripe adds a new subscription status you don't know about (they've done this before - added "paused" in 2020). Your code sees status="something_new", doesn't recognize it, defaults to "active". User gets FREE ACCESS when they shouldn't. **Real risk?** Low - Stripe rarely adds statuses. **Fix:** Default to "cancelled" instead (fail-safe). Takes 5 min.

decision.option_label: Default unknown statuses to "past_due" or a new "unknown" status that restricts access while logging for investigation. Active should only be set for explicitly known good statuses.

messages.text: ðŸ“– **You're right!** If you already show "X of Y prepaid seats used" with a billing link, users CAN see the math. **The finding is about expectations:** User removes teammate â†’ expects bill to go DOWN â†’ it doesn't (prepaid). Your UI explains it, but some users won't read. **Options:** (1) Skip - UI already explains it. (2) Add tooltip/confirmation when removing: "This frees a seat but won't reduce your bill until renewal."

âœ… Acknowledged: Co-browse opt-out is intentionally not available to visitors. This is confirmed as the desired behavior. Finding closed - no ticket needed. Note: Org-level disable toggle is available via TKT-009 for organizations that want to disable co-browse entirely.

ðŸ“– Rate limit info: ip-api.com free tier = 45 lookups per minute. At scale, we'd hit this fast. **Options:** (1) MaxMind GeoIP - --.10/1000 lookups, one-time DB download option is free but less accurate. (2) ip-api.com Pro - cd /Users/ryanodonnell/projects/Digital_greeter && node docs/scripts/pm-respond.js F-033 "ðŸ“– Rate limit info: ip-api.com free tier = 45 lookups per minute. At scale, we'd hit this fast. **Options:** (1) MaxMind GeoIP - $0.10/1000 lookups, one-time DB download option is free but less accurate. (2) ip-api.com Pro - $15/mo for 150k lookups. (3) Cloudflare - Free with their CDN (you're already using it?). **What matters:** If we hit rate limit, ALL visitors bypass the blocklist (fail-open). **Decision?** Pick a fallback strategy or let me know traffic expectations."5/mo for 150k lookups. (3) Cloudflare - Free with their CDN (you're already using it?). **What matters:** If we hit rate limit, ALL visitors bypass the blocklist (fail-open). **Decision?** Pick a fallback strategy or let me know traffic expectations.

ðŸ“– Rate limit info: ip-api.com free tier = 45 lookups per minute. At scale, we'd hit this fast.

**Options:**
(1) MaxMind GeoIP - $0.10/1000 lookups, one-time DB download option is free but less accurate.
(2) ip-api.com Pro - $15/mo for 150k lookups.
(3) Cloudflare - Free with their CDN (you're already using it?).

**What matters:** If we hit rate limit, ALL visitors bypass the blocklist (fail-open).

**Decision?** Pick a fallback strategy or let me know traffic expectations.

ðŸ“– Pros/Cons breakdown:

**(1) MaxMind GeoIP**
âœ… Pros: Industry standard, very accurate, no rate limits (local DB), one-time setup
âŒ Cons: $0.10/1000 API lookups OR download DB monthly (250MB), requires server-side code changes

**(2) ip-api.com Pro**
âœ… Pros: Already integrated, simple upgrade, good accuracy
âŒ Cons: $15/mo ongoing, still has 150k/mo limit, external dependency

**(3) Cloudflare**
âœ… Pros: FREE if you're on Cloudflare, automatic via CF-IPCountry header, no code changes
âŒ Cons: Only works if traffic goes through Cloudflare, less granular (country only, no city)

**My recommendation:** If you're already using Cloudflare CDN, option 3 is a no-brainer - it's free and instant. Otherwise, MaxMind is the most reliable for scale.

**What's your CDN setup?**
âœ… Got it! Creating ticket: Migrate to MaxMind GeoIP + only check IP on pages where widget is active.
